item.description:
One of my Favorite Bike Paths.  The Ride  takes you thru two swamps, from the comfy of a tarred path.  I have seen Deer along the path and plenty of birds.  Once we watched a Blue Heron, just hanging out in the water. Bring Binoculars, as the Osprey should be around. They are a huge Prehistoric looking Bird, that swoops down to catch fish, from the Swamp.   They added another small section, which will add a couple of miles.

 

You can ride 6,12, or even 24 miles.  ( or anything in between) You can set your own pace. I usually split into a few Groups, so everyone can ride at a pace they feel comfortable with.  Feel free to stop and see the scenery.  This is not a race.  There is a restroom at the train station. We usually head there first.

 

The New Directions, should avoid the Beach Traffic on Route 1.  FYI: The New Directions, will take you by U.R.I..

 

New Directions:  95 South,  Exit 9 / Route 4 South, this is a left lane exit,  Then take exit 5B,  take a left on Route 2 & continue on till you hit Route 138.  Left on Route 138 East / you can take a Right on Route 108 / at the Light go  Right on Curtis Corner Rd. ( NOTE : Sign may say Saugatucket Rd ) / School is down on the Right.

 

 

Directions: 95 South / Exit 9, Route 4 South / Route 1 South / Route 138 West / go 4 Miles Left at Light on Route 108 / at the Light go  Right on Curtis Corner Rd. ( NOTE : Sign may say Saugatucket Rd ) / School is down on the Right.
item.name: Bike the Wakefield Bike Path
